title: TEMPLATE: Maintenance task — {{title}}
description:
## Context
{{context}}

## Goal
{{goal}}

## Checklist
- Identify scope and blast radius (site-wide vs single post vs assets)
- Prefer editing theme overrides in `layouts/` and `assets/` (don’t edit `themes/` directly)
- If touching images: rename descriptively, convert to WebP (`cwebp` for stills, `gif2webp` for animations), remove originals, update Markdown links + meaningful alt text
- If touching letter art: it lives in `assets/letters/` and is Git LFS managed

## Validation
- Run `make build` (primary check is clean `hugo --minify` build)
- If relevant, run `make serve` to spot-check the change

## Notes
- Install/pull LFS assets before building if needed: `git lfs install && git lfs pull`
- Keep changes minimal and consistent with existing Hugo/SCSS patterns

title: TEMPLATE: Epic — Add Hugo multilingual (en/de/he)
description:
## Context
Implement Hugo multilingual mode using file-suffix translations (.en.md/.de.md/.he.md), add UI translations, language switcher, and RTL support for Hebrew.

## Goal
Site renders with correct language + direction attributes, UI strings translate via i18n files, a language switcher appears in the header, and RTL styling works for Hebrew.

## Scope
- In scope: hugo.toml language config; i18n/*.toml; layouts updates for lang/dir + i18n calls + switcher; SCSS RTL utilities
- Out of scope: Translating existing content (creating .de/.he markdown variants)

## Plan
- [ ] Decide approach and files to touch
- [ ] Implement changes
- [ ] Validate locally (`make build`; optionally `make serve`)
- [ ] Write/adjust docs if needed

## Notes
- Prefer overrides in `layouts/` and `assets/` (don’t edit `themes/` directly)
- Co-locate post images with their post under `content/posts/**/`
